choices.B: At some hardware platforms, BFD and NSF are not supported together. During supervisor engine or routing engine failover, the BFD at the peer router will trigger a link down.
choices.A: During supervisor engine or routing engine failover, the NSF feature will always ensure that the BFD at the peer router will not trigger a link down independent of the used hardware platform.
choices.C: To ensure that BFD at the peer router will not trigger a link down during NSF, the BFD packets must be processed fast enough, and, during supervisor engine or routing engine failover, by processing the BFD independent from the supervisor engine or routing engine.
choices.E: Because BFD is always processed at the supervisor engine or routing engine, a supervisor engine or routing engine failover will always trigger a link down at the peer router.
choices.D: Because BFD is always processed at the line cards (not at the supervisor engine or routing engine), a supervisor engine or routing engine failover will not affect the BFD peer router.

discussion.content: Not all platforms support bfd at hardware level

questions.question_text: A company plans to include Nonstop Forwarding and Bidirectional Forwarding Detection as a part of their network redundancy plan. In which two ways do NSF and BFD work together when different hardware platforms are compared? (Choose two.)

While reviewing an existing network design, you are discussing the characteristics of different STP versions. Which protocol minimizes unicast flooding during
TCN in a Layer 2 switched network with many VLANs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It is MSTP that would minimize the unicast flooding, when there are several VLANs.

comments.content: it's C - PVRSTP (Per-VLAN Rapid Spanning Tree Protocol)
D - U mean RPVST+. no such thing PVRSTP

choices.C: Serialization delays are invariable because they depend only on the line rate of the interface.
choices.B: Serialization delay depends not only on the line rate of the interface but also on the size of the packet.
choices.A: Serialization delays are variable because they depend on the line rate of the interface and on the type of the packet being serialized.
choices.D: Serialization delays are variable because they depend only on the size of the packet being serialized.
choices.E: Serialization delay is the time required to transmit the packet on the physical media.

questions.question_text: When designing a WAN that will be carrying real-time traffic, what are two important reasons to consider serialization delay? (Choose two.)

choices.B: implement QoS to increase available bandwidth and overall throughput
choices.D: configure SNMP MIB collectors to trigger at utilization thresholds
choices.A: analyze network bandwidth utilization to establish a baseline
choices.C: implement utilization measurement and tracking measures in the network

questions.question_text: Among the design criteria for a network is the requirement that bandwidth capacity be managed proactively. Which two techniques would most effectively support the proactive management of network bandwidth capacity? (Choose two.)
What are the two preferred mechanisms for detecting Layer 2 link failures quickly? (Choose two.)
